subject: Philosophy
title: When Rules Conflict
description: A fast breakdown of When Rules Conflict for builders.

hook.text: You promised to keep a secret. Then you learn the secret could save someone's life.

buildup.text: Duty-based ethics says keep your promises. It also says protect human life. Now what?

discovery.text: W. D. Ross proposed 'prima facie' duties â€” moral obligations that hold unless overridden by a stronger duty.

twist.text: There's no master ranking of duties. You must use judgment, and reasonable people may disagree.

climax.text: Ross admitted ethics can't be turned into an algorithm. Moral wisdom is about weighing, not calculating.

punchline.text: Rules guide us. Judgment finishes the job.

quiz.question: What did W. D. Ross call duties that can be overridden by stronger ones?
